creator: alelav79@gmail.com
text:
Hello,

i have problem with https . Any access to https generates segment fault.


# processes listening

lsof -i tcp:443

The server is located on VirtualBox (Debian 7 - 32bit x86). I have to increase the memory?
First, how do I resolve this?

Backtrace stopped: previous frame inner to this frame (corrupt stack?)
creator: alelav79@gmail.com
ylavic.dev@gmail.com
text:
Please open a thread on the users@httpd.apache.org mailing list, this bugzilla is for reporting bugs only (not for support), there are more evidences of incorrect building/linking here than an issue in httpd for now.

If this is not the case we'll reopen this ticket, though the version (2.1.11) is very old now, you'll probably need to reproduce with the latest 2.2.

Also provide more informations on the users@ list, like how you built/linked httpd and with which openssl (version) on your system, the SSL configuration, ...
